com.vmware.vapi.protocol.server.rpc.http

Interface Service

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    StaticContentService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ServiceImpl, StaticContentServiceImpl

    public interface Service
    Represents a service entry point.

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        String getPath()
        Get the path under which the service can be accessed.
        Returns:
        a standard servlet mapping pattern.

      • setPath

        void setPath(String path)
        Set the path under which the service can be accessed.

        The path must follow the standard Servlet spec mapping patterns:

        • Exact: starts with "/" and does not end with "/*".
        • Prefix: starts with "/" and ends with "/*".
        • Extension: starts with "*."
        • Default: equals "/".

        Request paths are tested against the mapping patterns in the standard order:

        1. Exact match: E.g. "/foo".
        2. Longest prefix match: E.g. "/foo/bar/*" is tested before "/foo/*".
        3. Longest extension match: E.g. "*.html" is tested before "*.htm".
        4. Default always matches: E.g. use this if no other matches.

        Note
        For backward compatibility all exact patterns are also registered under a path with a trailing "/". E.g. "/foo/bar/baz" is also registered under "/foo/bar/baz/".

        Parameters:
        path - the path

      • getServlet

        javax.servlet.Servlet getServlet()
        Get the Servlet that handles this service entry point.
        Returns:
        a Servlet object.

      • setServlet

        void setServlet(javax.servlet.Servlet servlet)
        Set a Servlet to handle this service.
        Parameters:
        servlet - the Servlet.

      • getInitParameters

        Map<String,String> getInitParameters()
        Get the parameters, which which the Servlet will be.
        Returns:
        a Map with the initial parameters or null if no initial configuration is set.

      • setInitParameters

        void setInitParameters(Map<String,String> params)
        Set the initial configuration of the servlet. These parameters will be accessible to the Servlet via it's ServletConfig.
        Parameters:
        params - the parameters.

      • setTransportGuarantee
